malare two approaches are commonly used
the static analysis which try to study
the malare without executing it and the
dynamic analysis which try to understand
what the malware does by executing it
and tracking Its Behavior
a reverse engineer is able to exploit
static analysis techniques to understand
the behavior of the Mal by uh analyzing
this assemble code the strings and the
imported
function however nowadays malare try to

engineering by unpacking and decrypting

packed malware the analysis of the
disassemble code and of the strings is

execution and the analys of the imported
function is impossible as well because
they are obfuscated and they are
resolved only during
runtime to deal with this problem there
are two approaches the manual approach
which is very time consuming but it can
adapt itself to deal with different
packing techniques and automatic
approach which is much faster can scale
well with the number of sample but it is
difficult to make it work to deal with
all the packing techniques our answer to
this problem is pin demonium pendemonium
is a generic unpacker which tries to
reconstruct the original Mal from its
packed version but it also provide a set
of functionalities in order to deal with
a custom situation and specific problems
pin demonium is based on Intel pin a
wellknown dynamic B instrumentation
framework before going into the details
of pin Dem monum we need to have a brief
overview of what a DBI
is a DBI is a tool which allows the
analysis of a binary by the insertion of
instrumentation
code we can see the program in the form
of a control flow graph as a set of
basic block a subset of this basic block
which is terminated by an conditional
jump is Define execution trace the first
thing that the DBI does is to identify
the current execution trace and copy it
in a hip allocated memory area called
code
cache at this point the DBI analyze the
code inside the code cache and allow the
insertion of user defined code with a
granularity at the level of the
instruction basic block or
Trace finally the DBI start the
execution of the newly created Trace
from the first instruction of the inside
the code cache moreover the DBI provides
additional functionalities like Windows
system call hooking and API
hooking the key idea behind the pin
demonium is to exploit the capabilities

the common pattern which every Packer

R time they need to write then write it
somewhere and then execute
it however this is just the first piece

its packet version to deal with this
